title: Israel war : Pro - Palestine university camps grow at universities
message:
The number of pro-Palestinian campsites at the nation’s universities has grown to four, as Jewish groups claim they are turning campuses into no-go areas for Jewish students and academics.
University of Sydney bachelor of science student Yasmine Johnson is the Students for Palestine organiser.
Credit: Louie DouvisIt has been almost a week since the encampment at the University of Sydney popped up, mirroring pro-Palestinian protest camps across the United States which began at Columbia University in New York on April 17.
Similar encampments have also been established at the University of Melbourne and the University of Queensland.
The University of Sydney is carefully monitoring the campsite and has so far not moved to remove it, as was done at Columbia University when administration called the police to move protesters on.
event_breakdown:
Reminder: My knowledge cut-off date is January 2022.

Hamas is designated as a terrorist organization by numerous countries and organizations, including the United States, the European Union, Israel, Canada, and others.

title: Israel war : Pro - Palestine university camps grow at universities
message:
The number of pro-Palestinian campsites at the nation’s universities has grown to four, as Jewish groups claim they are turning campuses into no-go areas for Jewish students and academics.
University of Sydney bachelor of science student Yasmine Johnson is the Students for Palestine organiser.
Credit: Louie DouvisIt has been almost a week since the encampment at the University of Sydney popped up, mirroring pro-Palestinian protest camps across the United States which began at Columbia University in New York on April 17.
Similar encampments have also been established at the University of Melbourne and the University of Queensland.
The University of Sydney is carefully monitoring the campsite and has so far not moved to remove it, as was done at Columbia University when administration called the police to move protesters on.
event_breakdown:
- Growth of pro-Palestinian campsites at Australian universities, totaling four.
- Yasmine Johnson, a bachelor of science student at the University of Sydney, is the organizer of Students for Palestine.
- Establishment of pro-Palestinian encampment at the University of Sydney, following similar protests at Columbia University in New York.
- Similar encampments established at the University of Melbourne and the University of Queensland.
- The University of Sydney monitoring the campsite without immediate removal, contrasting with the response at Columbia University where police were called to disperse protesters.

title: Texas GOP and UT - Austin leaders shift from championing free speech to policing protester intentions
message:
Greg Abbott signed a bill that enshrined new free speech protections on campuses.
And six months ago, during a celebration of Free Speech Week, University of Texas at Austin administrators touted the school’s expansive protections for free speech on campus — including speech that was anti-war or considered hate speech.
Free speech also loses First Amendment protections when it amounts to discriminatory harassment or true threats that incite imminent violence or destruction of public property.
Preventing unlawful assembly, as DPS described the governor’s instructions, is a slippery slope that can lead to preventing assembly altogether, free speech experts said.
And rules should not dissuade or discourage people from exercising free speech, she said.
event_breakdown:
- Greg Abbott signed a bill enshrining new free speech protections on campuses.
- University of Texas at Austin administrators touted the school's expansive protections for free speech during a celebration of Free Speech Week.
- Free speech loses First Amendment protections in cases of discriminatory harassment or true threats that incite imminent violence or destruction of public property.
- Preventing unlawful assembly is a slippery slope that can lead to preventing assembly altogether, according to free speech experts.
- Rules should not dissuade or discourage people from exercising free speech.

Free speech also loses First Amendment protections when it amounts to discriminatory harassment or true threats that incite imminent violence or destruction of public property.
Preventing unlawful assembly, as DPS described the governor’s instructions, is a slippery slope that can lead to preventing assembly altogether, free speech experts said.

- Rules should not dissuade or discourage people from exercising free speech

title: Texas GOP and UT - Austin leaders shift from championing free speech to policing protester intentions
message:
Greg Abbott signed a bill that enshrined new free speech protections on campuses.
And six months ago, during a celebration of Free Speech Week, University of Texas at Austin administrators touted the school’s expansive protections for free speech on campus — including speech that was anti-war or considered hate speech.
“Hate speech is not a category of speech the government can restrict,” Amanda Cochran-McCall, the university’s vice president for legal affairs, said at a school-affiliated Free Speech Week in October.
Free speech also loses First Amendment protections when it amounts to discriminatory harassment or true threats that incite imminent violence or destruction of public property.
Preventing unlawful assembly, as DPS described the governor’s instructions, is a slippery slope that can lead to preventing assembly altogether, free speech experts said.
event_breakdown:
- Greg Abbott signs a bill enshrining new free speech protections on campuses.
- University of Texas at Austin administrators tout expansive protections for free speech on campus during a celebration of Free Speech Week.
- Amanda Cochran-McCall, the university's vice president for legal affairs, asserts that hate speech is not a category of speech the government can restrict.
- Free speech loses First Amendment protections when it amounts to discriminatory harassment or true threats that incite imminent violence or destruction of public property.
- Free speech experts express concern that preventing unlawful assembly, as instructed by the governor, could lead to preventing assembly altogether.

title: McConnell likens Columbia protesters to  student Nazis of Weimar Germany  in call to restore order
message:
McConnell also excoriated the student protesters, comparing their behavior on Columbias campus to the brand of aggressive lawlessness shown by the student Nazis of Weimar Germany.
But just as the roots of this hate are not a mystery, neither is the way forward for college administrators.
It’s time for the leaders of America’s most elite universities to take serious action,” McConnell said.
It is not, as the White House press secretary described campus radicals’ motivations yesterday, a mere ‘difficult viewpoint,’” McConnell said.
Columbia University President Minouche Shafik said on Monday that the administration was unable to reach an agreement with protesters and would move ahead with having them removed from the encampment.
event_breakdown:
- McConnell criticizes student protesters at Columbia University, comparing their behavior to student Nazis of Weimar Germany
- McConnell calls for leaders of elite universities to take serious action
- McConnell rejects White House press secretary's description of campus radicals' motivations
- Columbia University President Minouche Shafik announces administration's inability to reach an agreement with protesters and plans to have them removed from the encampment

title: Arrests roil college campuses ahead of graduation as protesters demand financial ties to Israel be cut
message:
Protests are roiling college campuses nationwide as schools with graduation ceremonies next month face demands they cut financial ties to Israel because of the Israel-Hamas war.
About 275 people were arrested on Saturday at various campuses including Indiana University at Bloomington, Arizona State University and Washington University in St. Louis.
In the northern part of the state, officials on Saturday ordered an “enforced hard closure” of California State Polytechnic University, Humboldt.
MissouriWashington University in St. Louis locked some campus buildings and arrested protesters Saturday.
Israel and its supporters have branded the university protests as antisemitic, while critics of Israel say it uses such allegations to silence opponents.
event_breakdown:
1. Protests erupt on college campuses nationwide demanding financial ties to Israel be cut due to Israel-Hamas war.
2. Approximately 275 people arrested at various campuses including Indiana University at Bloomington, Arizona State University, and Washington University in St. Louis.
3. California State Polytechnic University, Humboldt experiences "enforced hard closure" ordered by officials in the northern part of the state.
4. Missouri's Washington University in St. Louis locks some campus buildings and arrests protesters.
5. Israel and its supporters criticize university protests as antisemitic, while critics argue that such allegations are used to silence opponents.

title: UVa students , faculty named in blacklist , accused of antisemitism without evidence
message:
An anonymous University of Virginia parent has accused two professors and one student of antisemitism for organizing an Israel-Palestine film series.
The series is sponsored by MESALC [Middle Eastern and South Asian Languages and Cultures] and UVA Jewish Studies,” reads Item 26 of the document.
Lefkowitz hoped that people would attend the entire film series instead of individual screenings.
On April 3, the Jewish Leadership Advisory Board, the largest Jewish student organization in Charlottesville, penned a letter to the Board of Visitors.
“It saddens us to see concerted efforts to exploit Jewish students as pawns for political agendas.
event_breakdown:
1. An anonymous University of Virginia parent accuses two professors and one student of antisemitism for organizing an Israel-Palestine film series.
2. The film series is sponsored by MESALC [Middle Eastern and South Asian Languages and Cultures] and UVA Jewish Studies.
3. Lefkowitz encourages attendance at the entire film series instead of individual screenings.
4. On April 3, the Jewish Leadership Advisory Board writes a letter to the Board of Visitors expressing concerns about exploiting Jewish students for political agendas.

title: Demonstrations roil US campuses ahead of graduations as protesters spar over the war in Gaza
message:
Some Jewish students say the protests have veered into antisemitism and made them afraid to set foot on campus.
The protests have even spread to Europe, with French police removing dozens of students from the Sorbonne university after pro-Palestinian protesters occupied the main courtyard.
In Canada, student protest camps have popped up at the University of Ottawa, McGill University in Montreal and the University of British Columbia in Vancouver, The Canadian Press reported.
The confrontation was an escalation on the 53,000-student campus in the state's capital, where more than 50 protesters were arrested last week.
In a rare case, Northwestern University said it reached an agreement with students and faculty who represent the majority of protesters on its campus near Chicago.
event_breakdown:
- Jewish students say protests have veered into antisemitism on some campuses
- French police remove pro-Palestinian protesters from the Sorbonne university in Paris
- Student protest camps reported at University of Ottawa, McGill University, and University of British Columbia in Canada
- More than 50 protesters arrested at 53,000-student campus in a state capital
- Northwestern University reaches agreement with majority of protesters near Chicago

title: Anti - Israel Demonstrations Roil College Campuses
message:
Protests are roiling college campuses across the U.S. as upcoming graduation ceremonies are threatened by disruptive demonstrators, with students and others sparring over the war in Gaza and its mounting death toll.
About 275 people were arrested on Saturday at various campuses including Indiana University at Bloomington, Arizona State University and Washington University in St. Louis.
Israel and its supporters have branded the university protests as antisemitic, while critics of Israel say it uses such allegations to silence opponents.
Washington University in St. Louis locked some campus buildings and arrested protesters Saturday.
About 102 protesters were arrested and will be charged with trespassing and disorderly conduct, the Massachusetts State Police said.
event_breakdown:
1. Protests erupt on college campuses in the U.S.
2. Approximately 275 people arrested at various campuses including Indiana University, Arizona State University, and Washington University in St. Louis.
3. Israel and its supporters label university protests as antisemitic.
4. Critics of Israel accuse it of using allegations of anti-Semitism to silence opponents.
5. Washington University in St. Louis locks some campus buildings and arrests protesters.
6. Around 102 protesters are arrested and will face charges of trespassing and disorderly conduct according to the Massachusetts State Police.

title: Demonstrations roil US campuses ahead of graduations as protesters spar over Gaza conflict
message: Colleges around the U.S. are imploring student protesters of the war on Gaza to clear out tent encampments with rising levels of urgency
event_breakdown: - Colleges around the U.S. implore student protesters of the war on Gaza to clear out tent encampments with rising levels of urgency.

title: Pro - Palestinian demonstrations seek to intimidate
message:
At the University of Michigan’s honors convocation, protesters booed and jeered — drowning out University President Santa Ono and abruptly ending the event.
These disruptive demonstrations seek to intimidate and drown out the voices of those with whom they disagree.
This is no longer about protests, this is about campus safety — particularly the safety of Jewish students, faculty and staff.
Other visibly Jewish students have been physically surrounded by these protesters, prevented from entering buildings or even continuing on their way on campus.
And, most importantly, they cannot tolerate the threatening and endangering of students, Jewish or otherwise.
event_breakdown:
- Disruptive protests at University of Michigan's honors convocation with protesters booing and jeering
- Intimidation and drowning out of voices by protesters
- Concerns raised about campus safety, particularly for Jewish students, faculty, and staff
- Visibly Jewish students being physically surrounded and prevented from entering buildings on campus
- Call to end threatening and endangering behavior towards students, Jewish or otherwise

title: Israel - Hamas war : Campus protesters dig in across U . S .
message:
Near George Washington University, protesters at an encampment breached and dismantled the barriers Monday morning used to secure University Yard, the university said in a statement.
Israel and its supporters have branded the university protests as antisemitic, while critics of Israel say it uses such allegations to silence opponents.
New YorkEarly protests at Columbia University in New York City, where demonstrators set up tents in the center of the campus, sparked pro-Palestinian demonstrations across the country.
MissouriWashington University in St. Louis locked some campus buildings and arrested protesters Saturday.
About 100 protesters were arrested and will be charged with trespassing and disorderly conduct, the Massachusetts State Police said.

title: Billboard near University of Michigan :  Stop Jew Hatred on Campus
message:
“The university has failed to respond to concerned students, parents and alumni who have contacted U of M, urging that it take action to stop violations of their own code of conduct and infractions of the law.
We put up the billboard in hopes of getting their attention,” said Sheldon Freilich, president of ZOA-Michigan.
The situation has been exacerbated, it added, by pro-Hamas demonstrations on campus and in campus buildings calling for the end of Israel and the genocide of Jews, often punctuated by Nazi symbols and slogans.
This week, she was one part of the pro-Palestinian and pro-Hamas activists that set up a tent encampment on school grounds.
PHOTO: BillboardCAP: A new billboard put up by the Michigan branch of the Zionist Organization of American near the University of Michigan in Ann Arbor is trying to draw attention to campus antisemitism.

title: Why did Hitler have such a problem with Jews ?
message:
Hitlers mother was being treated by a Jewish doctor, when she died suddenly.
Other Historians, claim that the fact that the doctor was Jewish didn’t matter to Hitler.
After all, they sought/accepted the help of the Jewish doctor in the first place.
It’s hard to see 1940’s Hitler, as having a Jewish doctor.
Although it’s important to note that Hitler rose to power after Germany had suffered defeat, and signed treaties that would financially stunt Germany for years to come.
event_breakdown:
- Hitler's mother was being treated by a Jewish doctor when she died suddenly
- Other historians claim that the fact that the doctor was Jewish didn't matter to Hitler
- They sought/accepted the help of the Jewish doctor in the first place
- It's hard to see 1940's Hitler as having a Jewish doctor
- Hitler rose to power after Germany had suffered defeat and signed treaties that would financially stunt Germany for years to come

title: College Democrats Come Out in Support of Columbia , Other College Protesters
message:
A few hours after Columbia students broke into, entered, and vandalized buildings on multiple college campuses including Columbia University, the College Democrats of America sent out a press release endorsing the protests.
AdvertisementAs much as the College Democrats keep repeating the word "peaceful" in their statement, the underlying events are anything but.
The statement had supermajority support from the College Democrats’ 10-member executive board, but two members voted against it.
The College Democrats do condemn antisemitism, they say, but they sure seem happy to ally with open antisemites.
Those are the people the College Democrats admire and stand with.
event_breakdown:
- Columbia students broke into, entered, and vandalized buildings on multiple college campuses including Columbia University 
- The College Democrats of America sent out a press release endorsing the protests 
- The statement had supermajority support from the College Democrats’ 10-member executive board, but two members voted against it 
- The College Democrats are said to condemn antisemitism, but appeared to ally with open antisemites

title: Sri Lanka : Hands off US university students ! Mobilise the working class in defense of all those protesting against genocide !
message:
The International Youth and Students for Social Equality (IYSSE) in Sri Lanka denounces President Biden’s administration’s ongoing police repression of students protesting the Israeli genocide in Gaza.
These and other Sri Lankan media outlets are attempting to poison the consciousness of the masses with this misinformation.
Sri Lankan workers and students have been involved in ongoing protests against the Wickremesinghe government’s International Monetary Fund austerity measures.
With more than 25 percent of the population now living in extreme poverty, Sri Lankan workers and the poor are fighting to defend their social conditions.
We urge students, youth and workers to register for this historic event.
event_breakdown:
- IYSSE in Sri Lanka denounces President Biden’s administration’s ongoing police repression of students protesting the Israeli genocide in Gaza 
- Sri Lankan media outlets trying to poison the consciousness of the masses with misinformation 
- Sri Lankan workers and students protesting against the Wickremesinghe government’s IMF austerity measures 
- Over 25% of the population in Sri Lanka now living in extreme poverty 
- Sri Lankan workers and the poor fighting to defend their social conditions

title: Pro - Palestine campus group behind Columbia University protests received over $3million a year in funding from  charitie linked to Hamas
message:
The group behind pro-Palestine student protests at Columbia received 'over $3 million a year' – and is linked to organizations accused of funding terrorist organization Hamas, a new think tank has revealed.
Students for Justice in Palestine (SJP), a campus group with more than 250 chapters across the country, is one of the main organizers of a protest that brought the Manhattan university to a standstill.
In the days after the October 7 deadly terror attacks by Hamas, SJP national leaders released a 'Day of Resistance Toolkit' which encouraged 'not just slogans and rallies, but armed confrontation with oppressors' in Israel.
A pro-Hamas protestor calling on the Al-Qasam brigade (the military wing of Hamas) to kill Jewish students.
'ISGAP calls for SJP (and its affiliated organizations) to be banned and for Jewish students to be protected.'
location: My knowledge cut-off date is January 2022. Hamas is designated as a terrorist organization by numerous countries and organizations, including the United States, the European Union, Israel, and others.

title: Elisha Wiesel : Even amid war against Hamas , Jews must advocate for Uyghurs
message:
There’s no crematoria,” he told JNS.
’Unpopular causes’“My father loved unpopular causes,” Wiesel told JNS, citing Elie Wiesel’s advocacy for Soviet Jewry before theirs became a cause that American Jews embraced widely and for Bosnian Muslims.
Wiesel told JNS that the foundation hired an artist, Chris Sojka, to create an installation that tells the story of the Uyghurs.
Wiesel told JNS that he met a man who learned he was on “a list” and fled China, leaving his wife and 6-year-old daughter behind.
Credit: Courtesy of the Elie Wiesel Foundation for Humanity.

title: Law enforcement standoff with protesters continues on Tulane campus
message:
Six campus intruders were arrested by Tulane University Police, the university said, including one student.
Tulane student Yasmeen Ohebsion spoke against the demands and questioned how the protestors choice of tactics.
“The establishment of this encampment reflects profound failures in safeguarding the well-being of Jewish students on campus,” the statement reads.
The university's Jewish student organizations issued a statement demanding the encampment be taken down over concerns of student safety.
A group of Jewish students took up a position near the makeshift encampment, holding Israeli flags in their show of solidarity.
event_breakdown:
1. Six campus intruders, including one student, were arrested by Tulane University Police.
2. Tulane student Yasmeen Ohebsion criticized the protestors' tactics.
3. The establishment of an encampment on campus was condemned for failing to safeguard the well-being of Jewish students.
4. Jewish student organizations demanded the removal of the encampment due to safety concerns.
5. Jewish students showed solidarity by gathering near the encampment with Israeli flags.

title: 2024 March of the Living to commemorate Hungarian Jews - Israel News
message:
On May 6, 2024, for the 36th march, fifty-five Holocaust Survivors from different countries, including those who were also victims of Hamas’ October 7 attacks, will take part in the march.
The march will conclude with a ceremony at the Keleti Train Station, the site of the first deportation of Hungarian Jews to Auschwitz-Birkenau.
In total, more than 550,000 Hungarian Jews were murdered during the Holocaust, according to Yad Vashem.
Among the 55 Holocaust survivors leading the march are 21 Holocaust survivors from Hungary and seven survivors who were personally impacted by the October 7 attack in Israel.
"Together, we will rise from the ashes of this horrific attack and foster prosperity and abundance in the years ahead."
event_breakdown:
- On May 6, 2024, fifty-five Holocaust Survivors from different countries participate in the 36th march.
- The march concludes with a ceremony at Keleti Train Station, where the first deportation of Hungarian Jews to Auschwitz-Birkenau took place.
- More than 550,000 Hungarian Jews were murdered during the Holocaust.
- Among the 55 Holocaust survivors leading the march, 21 are from Hungary and seven were impacted by the October 7 attack in Israel.

title: How Soro Latest Agitprop Exposed The Hypocrisy Of The Right
message:
blueapples on XIt should come as no surprise that the pro-Palestinian protests across college campuses nationwide have been exposed as another agitprop operation funded by none other than George Soros.
That unconstitutional violation of the rights to free speech and free assembly wasn't limited to targeting demonstrations defying the government response to the pandemic alone.
Pro-Palestinian protests have enabled social architects like him behind the protests to carefully craft a narrative in response that furthers their ulterior motives.
In recent days, pro-Palestinian protesters have been confronted by pro-Israel demonstrators who have been mobilized to oppose their counterparts.
What the Marxist undertones of this coordinated attack on free speech show is how deeply ingrained Soros' influence on American politics has become.
event_breakdown:
- Pro-Palestinian protests across college campuses nationwide exposed as funded by George Soros
- Unconstitutional violation of rights to free speech and free assembly targeting various demonstrations
- Social architects behind pro-Palestinian protests crafting a narrative to further ulterior motives
- Pro-Palestinian protesters confronted by pro-Israel demonstrators in recent days
- Marxist undertones of coordinated attack on free speech show Soros' deep influence on American politics

title: Rep . Ilhan Omar Accused of  Blood Libel  By ADL For Calling Some Jewish Students  Pro - Genocide  At Columbia Protest
message:
U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar has been accused of "blood libel" by the Anti-Defamation League for calling Jewish college students "pro-genocide" amid escalating protests against Israel's actions in Gaza, RadarOnline.com can confirm.
The Democratic congresswoman made the comment while speaking to a reporter as she attended a pro-Palestine protest at Columbia University on Friday.
"I think it is really unfortunate that people don't care about the fact that all Jewish kids should be kept safe and that we should not have to tolerate antisemitism or bigotry for all Jewish students, whether they are pro-genocide or anti-genocide," Omar said at the event, where organizers were demanding peace in Gaza.
event_breakdown: The event occurred at Columbia University in New York City, where U.S. Rep. Ilhan Omar attended a pro-Palestine protest and made comments regarding Jewish college students, sparking accusations of "blood libel" by the Anti-Defamation League.

title: Students Sue After CUNY Folds to Backlash Against Muslim Commencement Speakers
message:
Mohammed applauded CUNY’s law school for supporting students who speak out against Israel’s treatment of Palestinians, but she also had critiques.
The backlash was swift and largely came from outside of CUNY and its historic law school in Queens.
Once again, the Jewish Law Students Association publicly stood with Mohammed and her right to free speech after she too came under attack.
As graduation approaches, eight CUNY law students — including Horowitz — have teamed with Muslim Advocates, a civil rights group, to file a lawsuit against the school, alleging unlawful discrimination and demanding their First Amendment right to elect a commencement speaker.
On April 30, CUNY’s law school lost two more speakers for upcoming graduation ceremonies.
event_breakdown:
- Mohammed applauded CUNY’s law school for supporting students speaking out against Israel's treatment of Palestinians.
- Critiques from Mohammed towards CUNY's law school.
- Swift backlash largely from outside sources towards CUNY and its law school.
- Jewish Law Students Association publicly supported Mohammed and her free speech rights.
- Eight CUNY law students, including Horowitz, teamed up with Muslim Advocates to file a lawsuit against the school alleging unlawful discrimination and demanding their First Amendment right to elect a commencement speaker.
- On April 30, CUNY’s law school lost two more speakers for upcoming graduation ceremonies.

title: Student protests over the Israel - Hamas war roil US campuses ahead of graduations
message:
University of Texas handcuff a pro-Palestinian protester on the Austin campus on April 29, 2024.
Some Jewish students say the protests have veered into antisemitism and made them afraid to set foot on campus.
The protests have even spread to Europe, with French police removing dozens of students from the Sorbonne university after pro-Palestinian protesters occupied the main courtyard.
The confrontation was an escalation on the 53,000-student campus in the state’s capital, where more than 50 protesters were arrested last week.
In a rare case, Northwestern University said it reached an agreement with students and faculty who represent the majority of protesters on its campus near Chicago.

message:

“The establishment of this encampment reflects profound failures in safeguarding the well-being of Jewish students on campus,” the statement reads.

At least one school, the University of Southern California, cancelled its main graduation ceremony this spring.
About 275 people were arrested Saturday at various campuses including Indiana University at Bloomington, Arizona State University and Washington University in St. Louis.
Israel and its supporters have branded the university protests as antisemitic, while critics of Israel say it uses such allegations to silence opponents.
MISSOURI Washington University in St. Louis locked some campus buildings and arrested protesters Saturday.

title: Yom HaShoah Holocaust Remembrance to be held amid war , increase in antisemitism
message:
Bertenthal said the members of the Yom HaShoah Committee were of various faiths, including Judaism, Islam and Christianity.
“This is the most agonizing preparation of the Yom HaShoah liturgy that I’ve ever experienced.
The 43rd annual Quad Cities Holocaust Remembrance, or Yom HaShoah, will be held at 7 p.m. Sunday, May 5, at the Paul V. Galvin Fine Arts Center at St. Ambrose University in Davenport.
Each year, the Yom HaShoah features essay and art contests in which young students participate, she said.
The winner of the essay contest gets to read their essay during the Yom HaShoah program.
event_breakdown:

- The Yom HaShoah event includes essay and art contests for young students.
- The winner of the essay contest will have the opportunity to read their essay during the Yom HaShoah program.

title: UVa students set up  liberated zone  on Lawn , demand school divest from Israel
message:
Students at the University of Virginia are planning a “day-long liberated zone” on the school's Lawn Wednesday to demonstrate their solidarity with the Palestinian people as Israel continues to lay siege to the Palestinian territory of Gaza.
It was unclear at press time if that early encampment would remain after organizers announced police had asked them to clear the area.
“During the ‘May Days’ strike of 1970, UVA students announced a ‘Freedom Day’ to rally students together in their opposition to the U.S. imperialist war in Vietnam,” the post reads.
Protesters have been arrested at encampments and "liberated zones" at the University of Mary Washington, Virginia Tech and Virginia Commonwealth University in the past week.
On Tuesday, Republican Rep. Bob Good, who represents UVa and the surrounding 5th District in Congress, wrote a letter to UVa President Jim Ryan.

- Republican Rep. Bob Good writing a letter to UVa President Jim Ryan

title: Here the latest on the protests at major US universities
message:
College campuses across the United States have been roiled by pro-Palestinian protests this month, with nearly all demonstrations calling for universities to divest from Israel in some form.
So far, universities have refused to yield to those demands.
Many universities have an endowment, which is donated funds generally invested in stocks, bonds and other financial instruments to help the university earn money.
At Columbia, a group of students want the college to divest its $13.6 billion endowment from any company linked to Israel, including Microsoft and Amazon.
Protesters at other schools, such as Cornell and Yale, want their universities to stop investing in weapons manufacturers.
location: My knowledge cut-off date is January 2022. Hamas is designated as a terrorist organization by numerous countries and organizations, including the United States, the European Union, Israel, and others.

- Pro-Palestinian protests on college campuses across the United States calling for divestment from Israel
- Universities refusing to yield to divestment demands
- Calls for universities like Columbia to divest endowment from companies linked to Israel
- Protests at schools like Cornell and Yale demanding universities to stop investing in weapons manufacturers

RELATED COVERAGEVCU did not say how it determined that some of the protesters were not students of the school.
Final exams begin this week and VCU must provide students the opportunity to safely and successfully complete the semester.

title: How universities are cracking down on a swell of tension months into student protests
message:
How universities are cracking down on a swell of tension months into student protestsWith tension mounting over an encampment in support of Palestinians at New York's Columbia University, police strode onto campus this month and arrested more than 100 demonstrators.
RELATED: College protests updates: More protests, encampments pop up at Princeton, Northwestern and moreIt is a "drastic action" that "should be reserved for only the most direct and severe threats to campus safety," Greenberg said.
Ash told CNN he was one of 20 students arrested following a sit-in on November 8.
Separately, the referendum on the BDS resolution "did not move forward because of potential conflict with federal and state laws," the university told CNN in a statement.
Masked student protesters' refusal to identify themselves also was "unacceptable," it said.

- 20 students, including Ash, were arrested during a sit-in on November 8 at the university
- A referendum on a BDS resolution did not move forward at Columbia University due to potential conflict with federal and state laws
- The university criticized masked student protesters for refusing to identify themselves

title: Gaza Protests : College Administrators Fall For Right - Wing Trap
message:
Back then, college presidents routinely caved to the demands of conservative legislators, angry taxpayers and other wellsprings of anticommunist outrage against students striking for peace and civil rights.
If the past is any indication, the road ahead won’t be any easier for college presidents like Shafik.
Lawfare from the rightThroughout the 1960s, students organized a host of anti-war and civil rights protests, and many conservatives characterized the demonstrators as communist sympathizers.
They demanded civil rights protections and racially representative curricula.
As the U.S. presidential election approaches, I’ll be watching to see how the Trump and Biden campaigns respond to ongoing student protests.
event_breakdown:
- College presidents caving to demands of conservative legislators, angry taxpayers, and anticommunist outrage against striking students
- Students organizing anti-war and civil rights protests throughout the 1960s
- Conservatives characterizing protesters as communist sympathizers
- Demands for civil rights protections and racially representative curricula
- Monitoring Trump and Biden campaigns' responses to ongoing student protests

title: Columbia students who witnessed anti - Israel protester building takeover speaks out
message:
Two students at Columbia University are describing the anarchic scenes at Columbia University overnight, when demonstrators took over an academic building.
The students say the lax security on campus – where anti-Israel protesters have been running wild while outside agitators have infiltrated the campus – has left them feeling abandoned and alone.
"This is a very important building… this is where the dean of Columbia Colleges is, it's where the center for the core curriculum is and that's the centerpiece of every student's academic experience."
Du said Columbia University has lost control of its gates and that outside agitators have infiltrated the campus.
You can't negotiate with students who have shown that they're willing to be arrested to break the rules," Du said.
event_breakdown:
- Demonstrators take over academic building at Columbia University
- Lax security on campus allows for anarchic scenes
- Anti-Israel protesters causing chaos on campus
- Outside agitators infiltrate the campus
- Students feel abandoned and alone due to lack of security
- Columbia University loses control of its gates
- Inability to negotiate with rule-breaking students
